abstract: Fiat Chrysler chief Sergio Marchionne suggests to analysts that global auto industry needs large-scale integrations that would lower the number of players and consolidate high capital costs of manufacturing cleaner vehicles; firm reports lower-than-expected first quarter profits; North American profits rose 60 percent, and operating margins rose 5 percent.
lead_paragraph: Sergio Marchionne issued a plea on Wednesday for decreasing the number of players in the global auto industry as his company reported lower-than-expected first-quarter results.

headline.main: Fiat’s Chief Says Auto Industry Should Have Fewer Players
headline.print_headline: Fiat’s Chief Says Auto Industry Should Have Fewer Players

snippet: Sergio Marchionne issued a plea on Wednesday for decreasing the number of players in the global auto industry as his company reported lower-than-expected first-quarter results.
